071/**
072 * Mocked {@link RestClient}.
073 *
074 * <p>
075 *    This class is used for performing serverless unit testing of {@link Rest @Rest}-annotated and {@link Remote @Remote}-annotated classes.
076 *
077 * <p>
078 *    The class itself extends from {@link RestClient} providing it with the rich feature set of that API and combines
079 *    it with the Apache HttpClient {@link HttpClientConnection} interface for processing requests.
080 *  The class converts {@link HttpRequest} objects to instances of {@link MockServletRequest} and {@link MockServletResponse} which are passed directly
081 *  to the call handler on the resource class {@link RestContext#execute(Object,HttpServletRequest,HttpServletResponse)}.
082 *  In effect, you're fully testing your REST API as if it were running in a live servlet container, yet not
083 *  actually having to run in a servlet container.
084 *  All aspects of the client and server side code are tested, yet no servlet container is required.  The actual
085 *  over-the-wire transmission is the only aspect being bypassed.
086 *
087 * <p>
088 * The following shows a simple example of invoking a PUT method on a simple REST interface and asserting the correct status code and response body:
089 *
090 * <h5 class='figure'>Example:</h5>
091 * <p class='bjava'>
092 *    <jk>public class</jk> MockTest {
093 *
094 *       <jc>// A simple bean with one field.</jc>
095 *       <jk>public static class</jk> MyBean {
096 *          <jk>public int</jk> <jf>foo</jf> = 1;
097 *       }
098 *
099 *       <jc>// Our REST resource to test.</jc>
100 *       <jc>// Simply echos the response.</jc>
101 *       <ja>@Rest</ja>(
102 *          serializers=Json5Serializer.<jk>class</jk>,
103 *          parsers=JsonParser.<jk>class</jk>
104 *       )
105 *       <jk>public static class</jk> EchoRest {
106 *
107 *          <ja>@RestPut</ja>(
108 *             path=<js>"/echo"</js>
109 *          )
110 *          <jk>public</jk> MyBean echo(<ja>@Content</ja> MyBean <jv>bean</jv>) {
111 *             <jk>return</jk> <jv>bean</jv>;
112 *          }
113 *       }
114 *
115 *       <jc>// Our JUnit test.</jc>
116 *       <ja>@Test</ja>
117 *       <jk>public void</jk> testEcho() <jk>throws</jk> Exception {
118 *
119 *          MyBean <jv>myBean</jv> = <jk>new</jk> MyBean();
120 *
121 *          <jc>// Do a round-trip on the bean through the REST interface</jc>
122 *          <jv>myBean</jv> = MockRestClient
123 *             .<jsm>create</jsm>(EchoRest.<jk>class</jk>)
124 *             .json5()
125 *             .build()
126 *             .put(<js>"/echo"</js>, <jv>myBean</jv>)
127 *             .run()
128 *             .assertStatus().is(200)
129 *             .assertContent().is(<js>"{foo:1}"</js>)
130 *             .getContent().as(MyBean.<jk>class</jk>);
131 *
132 *          <jsm>assertEquals</jsm>(1, <jv>myBean</jv>.<jf>foo</jf>);
133 *       }
134 *    }
135 * </p>
136 * <p>
137 *    Breaking apart the fluent method call above will help you understand how this works.
138 *
139 * <p class='bjava'>
140 *    <ja>@Test</ja>
141 *    <jk>public void</jk> testEcho() <jk>throws</jk> Exception {
142 *
143 *       <jc>// Instantiate our mock client.</jc>
144 *       MockRestClient <jv>client</jv> = MockRestClient
145 *          .<jsm>create</jsm>(EchoRest.<jk>class</jk>)
146 *          .json5()
147 *          .build();
148 *
149 *       <jc>// Create a request.</jc>
150 *       RestRequest <jv>req</jv> = <jv>client</jv>.put(<js>"/echo"</js>, <jv>bean</jv>);
151 *
152 *       <jc>// Execute it (by calling RestCallHandler.service(...) and then returning the response object).</jc>
153 *       RestResponse <jv>res</jv> = <jv>req</jv>.run();
154 *
155 *       <jc>// Run assertion tests on the results.</jc>
156 *       <jv>res</jv>.assertStatus().is(200);
157 *       <jv>res</jv>.assertContent().is(<js>"'foo'"</js>);
158 *
159 *       <jc>// Convert the content of the response to a bean.</jc>
160 *       <jv>bean</jv> = <jv>res</jv>.getContent().as(MyBean.<jk>class</jk>);
161 *    }
162 * </p>
163 *
164 * <p>
165 *    The <c>create(Object)</c> method can take in either <c>Class</c> objects or pre-instantiated beans.
166 *    The latter is particularly useful for testing Spring beans.
167 *
168 * <p>
169 *    The {@link MockRestRequest} object has convenience methods provided to allow you to set any properties
170 *    directly on the underlying {@link HttpServletRequest} object.  The following example shows how
171 *    this can be used to directly set roles on the request object to perform security testing.
172 *
173 * <h5 class='figure'>Example:</h5>
174 * <p class='bjava'>
175 *    <ja>@Rest</ja>(roleGuard=<js>"ADMIN"</js>)
176 *    <jk>public class</jk> A {
177 *       <ja>@RestGet</ja>
178 *       <jk>public</jk> String get() {
179 *          <jk>return</jk> <js>"OK"</js>;
180 *       }
181 *    }
182 *
183 *    <ja>@Test</ja>
184 *    <jk>public void</jk> mytest() <jk>throws</jk> Exception {
185 *       MockRestClient <jv>client</jv> = MockRestClient.<jsm>build</jsm>(A.<jk>class</jk>);
186 *
187 *       <jc>// Admin user should get 200, but anyone else should get 403-Unauthorized.</jc>
188 *       <jv>client</jv>.get().roles(<js>"ADMIN"</js>).run().assertStatus().is(200);
189 *       <jv>client</jv>.get().roles(<js>"USER"</js>).run().assertStatus().is(403);
190 *    }
191 * </p>
192 *
193 * <p>
194 *    Debug mode is provided that will cause your HTTP requests and responses to be sent to the console:
195 *
196 * <h5 class='figure'>Example:</h5>
197 * <p class='bjava'>
198 *    MockRestClient <jv>client</jv> = MockRestClient
199 *       .<jsm>create</jsm>(MyRest.<jk>class</jk>)
200 *       .debug()
201 *       .json5()
202 *       .build();
203 * </p>
204 *
205 * <p>
206 *    The class can also be used for testing of {@link Remote @Remote}-annotated interfaces against {@link Rest @Rest}-annotated resources.
207 *
208 * <h5 class='figure'>Example:</h5>
209 * <p class='bjava'>
210 *    <jc>// Our remote resource to test.</jc>
211 *    <ja>@Remote</ja>
212 *    <jk>public interface</jk> MyRemoteInterface {
213 *
214 *       <ja>@RemoteGet</ja>(<js>"/echoQuery"</js>)
215 *       <jk>public int</jk> echoQuery(<ja>@Query</ja>(name=<js>"id"</js>) <jk>int</jk> <jv>id</jv>);
216 *    }
217 *
218 *    <jc>// Our mocked-up REST interface to test against.</jc>
219 *    <ja>@Rest</ja>
220 *    <jk>public class</jk> MyRest {
221 *
222 *       <ja>@RestGet</ja>(path=<js>"/echoQuery"</js>)
223 *       <jk>public int</jk> echoQuery(<ja>@Query</ja>(<js>"id"</js>) String <jv>id</jv>) {
224 *          <jk>return</jk> <jv>id</jv>;
225 *       }
226 *    }
227 *
228 *    <ja>@Test</ja>
229 *    <jk>public void</jk> testProxy() {
230 *       MyRemoteInterface <jv>client</jv> = MockRestClient
231 *          .create(MyRest.<jk>class</jk>)
232 *          .json()
233 *          .build()
234 *          .getRemote(MyRemoteInterface.<jk>class</jk>);
235 *
236 *       <jsm>assertEquals</jsm>(123, <jv>client</jv>.echoQuery(123));
237 *    }
238 * </p>
239 *
240 * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
241 *    <li class='note'>This class is thread safe and reusable.
242 * </ul>
243 *
244 * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
245 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://juneau.apache.org/docs/topics/JuneauRestMockBasics">juneau-rest-mock Basics</a>
246 * </ul>
247 */
248public class MockRestClient extends RestClient implements HttpClientConnection {
249
250   //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
251   // Static
252   //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
253
254   private static Map<Class<?>,RestContext> REST_CONTEXTS = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
255
256   /**
257    * Creates a new {@link org.apache.juneau.rest.client.RestClient.Builder} configured with the specified REST implementation bean or bean class.
258    *
259    * @param impl
260    *    The REST bean or bean class annotated with {@link Rest @Rest}.
261    *    <br>If a class, it must have a no-arg constructor.
262    * @return A new builder.
263    */
264   public static Builder create(Object impl) {
265      return new Builder().restBean(impl);
266   }
267
268   /**
269    * Creates a new {@link org.apache.juneau.rest.client.RestClient.Builder} configured with the specified REST implementation bean or bean class.
270    *
271    * <p>
272    * Same as {@link #create(Object)} but HTTP 400+ codes don't trigger {@link RestCallException RestCallExceptions}.
273    *
274    * @param impl
275    *    The REST bean or bean class annotated with {@link Rest @Rest}.
276    *    <br>If a class, it must have a no-arg constructor.
277    * @return A new builder.
278    */
279   public static Builder createLax(Object impl) {
280      return new Builder().restBean(impl).ignoreErrors().noTrace();
281   }
282
283   /**
284    * Creates a new {@link RestClient} with no registered serializer or parser.
285    *
286    * <p>
287    * Equivalent to calling:
288    * <p class='bjava'>
289    *    MockRestClient.<jsm>create</jsm>(<jv>impl</jv>).build();
290    * </p>
291    *
292    * @param impl
293    *    The REST bean or bean class annotated with {@link Rest @Rest}.
294    *    <br>If a class, it must have a no-arg constructor.
295    * @return A new builder.
296    */
297   public static MockRestClient build(Object impl) {
298      return create(impl).build();
299   }
300
301   /**
302    * Creates a new {@link RestClient} with no registered serializer or parser.
303    *
304    * <p>
305    * Same as {@link #build(Object)} but HTTP 400+ codes don't trigger {@link RestCallException RestCallExceptions}.
306    *
307    * <p>
308    * Equivalent to calling:
309    * <p class='bjava'>
310    *    MockRestClient.<jsm>create</jsm>(<jv>impl</jv>).ignoreErrors().noTrace().build();
311    * </p>
312    *
313    * @param impl
314    *    The REST bean or bean class annotated with {@link Rest @Rest}.
315    *    <br>If a class, it must have a no-arg constructor.
316    * @return A new builder.
317    */
318   public static MockRestClient buildLax(Object impl) {
319      return create(impl).ignoreErrors().noTrace().build();
320   }
321
322   /**
323    * Creates a new {@link RestClient} with JSON marshalling support.
324    *
325    * <p>
326    * Equivalent to calling:
327    * <p class='bjava'>
328    *    MockRestClient.<jsm>create</jsm>(<jv>impl</jv>).json().build();
329    * </p>
330    *
331    * @param impl
332    *    The REST bean or bean class annotated with {@link Rest @Rest}.
333    *    <br>If a class, it must have a no-arg constructor.
334    * @return A new builder.
335    */
336   public static MockRestClient buildJson(Object impl) {
337      return create(impl).json().build();
338   }
339
340   /**
341    * Creates a new {@link RestClient} with JSON marshalling support.
342    *
343    * <p>
344    * Same as {@link #buildJson(Object)} but HTTP 400+ codes don't trigger {@link RestCallException RestCallExceptions}.
345    *
346    * <p>
347    * Equivalent to calling:
348    * <p class='bjava'>
349    *    MockRestClient.<jsm>create</jsm>(<jv>impl</jv>).json().ignoreErrors().build();
350    * </p>
351    *
352    * @param impl
353    *    The REST bean or bean class annotated with {@link Rest @Rest}.
354    *    <br>If a class, it must have a no-arg constructor.
355    * @return A new builder.
356    */
357   public static MockRestClient buildJsonLax(Object impl) {
358      return create(impl).json().ignoreErrors().noTrace().build();
359   }
360
361   /**
362    * Creates a new {@link RestClient} with Simplified-JSON marshalling support.
363    *
364    * <p>
365    * Equivalent to calling:
366    * <p class='bjava'>
367    *    MockRestClient.<jsm>create</jsm>(<jv>impl</jv>).json().build();
368    * </p>
369    *
370    * @param impl
371    *    The REST bean or bean class annotated with {@link Rest @Rest}.
372    *    <br>If a class, it must have a no-arg constructor.
373    * @return A new builder.
374    */
375   public static MockRestClient buildJson5(Object impl) {
376      return create(impl).json5().build();
377   }
378
379   /**
380    * Creates a new {@link RestClient} with Simplified-JSON marshalling support.
381    *
382    * <p>
383    * Same as {@link #buildJson5(Object)} but HTTP 400+ codes don't trigger {@link RestCallException RestCallExceptions}.
384    *
385    * <p>
386    * Equivalent to calling:
387    * <p class='bjava'>
388    *    MockRestClient.<jsm>create</jsm>(<jv>impl</jv>).json().ignoreErrors().build();
389    * </p>
390    *
391    * @param impl
392    *    The REST bean or bean class annotated with {@link Rest @Rest}.
393    *    <br>If a class, it must have a no-arg constructor.
394    * @return A new builder.
395    */
396   public static MockRestClient buildJson5Lax(Object impl) {
397      return create(impl).json5().ignoreErrors().noTrace().build();
398   }
399
400   //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
401   // Builder
402   //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
403
404   /**
405    * Builder class.
406    */
407   @FluentSetters(ignore="debug")
408   public static class Builder extends RestClient.Builder {
409
410      Object restBean;
411      String contextPath, servletPath;
412      RestContext restContext;
413      Map<String,String> pathVars;
414
415      /**
416       * No-arg constructor.
417       *
418       * <p>
419       * Provided so that this class can be easily subclassed.
420       */
421      protected Builder() {
422         connectionManager(new MockHttpClientConnectionManager());
423      }
424
425      @Override /* Context.Builder */
426      public Builder copy() {
427         throw new NoSuchMethodError("Not implemented.");
428      }
429
430      /**
431       * Specifies the {@link Rest}-annotated bean class or instance to test against.
432       *
433       * @param value The {@link Rest}-annotated bean class or instance.
434       * @return This object.
435       */
436      public Builder restBean(Object value) {
437         restBean = value;
438         return this;
439      }
440
441      /**
442       * Specifies the {@link RestContext} created for the REST bean.
443       *
444       * @param value The {@link RestContext} created for the REST bean.
445       * @return This object.
446       */
447      public Builder restContext(RestContext value) {
448         restContext = value;
449         return this;
450      }
451
452      /**
453       * Identifies the context path for the REST resource.
454       *
455       * <p>
456       *    This value is used to deconstruct the request URL and set the appropriate URL getters on the {@link HttpServletRequest}
457       *    object correctly.
458       *
459       * <p>
460       *    Should either be a value such as <js>"/foo"</js> or an empty string.
461       *
462       * <p>
463       *    The following fixes are applied to non-conforming strings.
464       * <ul>
465       *    <li><jk>nulls</jk> and <js>"/"</js> are converted to empty strings.
466       *    <li>Trailing slashes are trimmed.
467       *    <li>Leading slash is added if needed.
468       * </ul>
469       *
470       * @param value The context path.
471       * @return This object.
472       */
473      public Builder contextPath(String value) {
474         contextPath = toValidContextPath(value);
475         return this;
476      }
477
478      /**
479       * Identifies the servlet path for the REST resource.
480       *
481       * <p>
482       *    This value is used to deconstruct the request URL and set the appropriate URL getters on the {@link HttpServletRequest}
483       *    object correctly.
484       *
485       * <p>
486       *    Should either be a value such as <js>"/foo"</js> or an empty string.
487       *
488       * <p>
489       *    The following fixes are applied to non-conforming strings.
490       * <ul>
491       *    <li><jk>nulls</jk> and <js>"/"</js> are converted to empty strings.
492       *    <li>Trailing slashes are trimmed.
493       *    <li>Leading slash is added if needed.
494       * </ul>
495       *
496       * @param value The context path.
497       * @return This object.
498       */
499      public Builder servletPath(String value) {
500         servletPath = toValidContextPath(value);
501         return this;
502      }
503
504      /**
505       * Add resolved path variables to this client.
506       *
507       * <p>
508       * Allows you to add resolved parent path variables when performing tests on child resource classes.
509       *
510       * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
511       * <p class='bjava'>
512       *    <jc>// A parent class with a path variable.</jc>
513       *    <ja>@Rest</ja>(
514       *       path=<js>"/parent/{foo}"</js>,
515       *       children={
516       *          Child.<jk>class</jk>
517       *       }
518       *    )
519       *    <jk>public class</jk> Parent { ... }
520       *
521       *    <jc>// A child class that uses the parent path variable.</jc>
522       *    <ja>@Rest</ja>
523       *    <jk>public class</jk> Child {
524       *
525       *       <jk>@RestGet</jk>
526       *       <jk>public</jk> String get(<ja>@Path</ja>(<js>"foo"</js>) String <jv>foo</jv>) {
527       *          <jk>return</jk> <jv>foo</jv>;
528       *       }
529       *    }
530       * </p>
531       * <p class='bjava'>
532       *    <jc>// Test the method that uses the parent path variable.</jc>
533       *    MockRestClient
534       *       .<jsm>create</jsm>(Child.<jk>class</jk>)
535       *       .json5()
536       *       .pathVars(<js>"foo"</js>,<js>"bar"</js>)
537       *       .build()
538       *       .get(<js>"/"</js>)
539       *       .run()
540       *       .assertStatus().asCode().is(200)
541       *       .assertContent().is(<js>"bar"</js>);
542       * </p>
543       *
544       * <review>Needs review</review>
545       *
546       * @param value The path variables.
547       * @return This object.
548       * @see MockServletRequest#pathVars(Map)
549       */
550      public Builder pathVars(Map<String,String> value) {
551         pathVars = value;
552         return this;
553      }
554
555      /**
556       * Add resolved path variables to this client.
557       *
558       * <p>
559       * Identical to {@link #pathVars(Map)} but allows you to specify as a list of key/value pairs.
560       *
561       * @param pairs The key/value pairs.  Must be an even number of parameters.
562       * @return This object.
563       */
564      public Builder pathVars(String...pairs) {
565         return pathVars(CollectionUtils.mapBuilder(String.class,String.class).addPairs((Object[])pairs).build());
566      }
567
568      /**
569       * Suppress logging on this client.
570       *
571       * @return This object.
572       */
573      public Builder suppressLogging() {
574         return logRequests(DetailLevel.NONE, null, null);
575      }
576
577      @Override /* Context.Builder */
578      public Builder debug() {
579         header("Debug", "true");
580         super.debug();
581         return this;
582      }
583
584      @Override /* Context.Builder */
585      public MockRestClient build() {
586         return build(MockRestClient.class);
587      }
588
589      // <FluentSetters>

592      public Builder annotations(Annotation...values) {
593         super.annotations(values);
594         return this;
595      }
596
597      @Override /* GENERATED - org.apache.juneau.Context.Builder */
598      public Builder apply(AnnotationWorkList work) {
599         super.apply(work);
600         return this;
601      }
602
603      @Override /* GENERATED - org.apache.juneau.Context.Builder */
604      public Builder applyAnnotations(Object...from) {
605         super.applyAnnotations(from);
606         return this;
607      }
608
609      @Override /* GENERATED - org.apache.juneau.Context.Builder */
610      public Builder applyAnnotations(Class<?>...from) {
611         super.applyAnnotations(from);
612         return this;
613      }
614
615      @Override /* GENERATED - org.apache.juneau.Context.Builder */
616      public Builder cache(Cache<HashKey,? extends org.apache.juneau.Context> value) {
617         super.cache(value);
618         return this;
619      }
620
621      @Override /* GENERATED - org.apache.juneau.Context.Builder */
622      public Builder impl(Context value) {
623         super.impl(value);
624         return this;
625      }
626
627      @Override /* GENERATED - org.apache.juneau.Context.Builder */
628      public Builder type(Class<? extends org.apache.juneau.Context> value) {
629         super.type(value);
630         return this;
631      }
632
633      @Override /* GENERATED - org.apache.juneau.BeanContextable.Builder */
634      public Builder beanClassVisibility(Visibility value) {
635         super.beanClassVisibility(value);
636         return this;
637      }
638
639      @Override /* GENERATED - org.apache.juneau.BeanContextable.Builder */
640      public Builder beanConstructorVisibility(Visibility value) {
641         super.beanConstructorVisibility(value);
642         return this;
643      }
644
645      @Override /* GENERATED - org.apache.juneau.BeanContextable.Builder */
646      public Builder beanContext(BeanContext value) {
647         super.beanContext(value);
648         return this;
649      }
650
651      @Override /* GENERATED - org.apache.juneau.BeanContextable.Builder */
652      public Builder beanContext(BeanContext.Builder value) {
653         super.beanContext(value);
654         return this;
655      }

1831
1832   //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1833   // Instance
1834   //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
1835
1836   private final RestContext restContext;
1837   private final Object restObject;
1838   private final String contextPath, servletPath;
1839   private final Map<String,String> pathVars;
1840
1841   private final ThreadLocal<HttpRequest> rreq = new ThreadLocal<>();
1842   private final ThreadLocal<MockRestResponse> rres = new ThreadLocal<>();
1843   private final ThreadLocal<MockServletRequest> sreq = new ThreadLocal<>();
1844   private final ThreadLocal<MockServletResponse> sres = new ThreadLocal<>();
1845
1846   /**
1847    * Constructor.
1848    *
1849    * @param builder
1850    *    The builder for this object.
1851    */
1852   public MockRestClient(Builder builder) {
1853      super(preInit(builder));
1854      restContext = builder.restContext;
1855      contextPath = builder.contextPath != null ? builder.contextPath : "";
1856      servletPath = builder.servletPath != null ? builder.servletPath : "";
1857      pathVars = builder.pathVars != null ? builder.pathVars : emptyMap();
1858      restObject = restContext.getResource();
1859
1860      HttpClientConnectionManager ccm = getHttpClientConnectionManager();
1861      if (ccm instanceof MockHttpClientConnectionManager)
1862         ((MockHttpClientConnectionManager)ccm).init(this);
1863   }
1864
1865   private static Builder preInit(Builder builder) {
1866      try {
1867         Object restBean = builder.restBean;
1868         String contextPath = builder.contextPath;
1869         String servletPath = builder.servletPath;
1870         String rootUrl = builder.getRootUri();
1871         if (rootUrl == null)
1872            rootUrl = "http://localhost";
1873
1874         Class<?> c = restBean instanceof Class ? (Class<?>)restBean : restBean.getClass();
1875         if (! REST_CONTEXTS.containsKey(c)) {
1876            boolean isClass = restBean instanceof Class;
1877            Object o = isClass ? ((Class<?>)restBean).getDeclaredConstructor().newInstance() : restBean;
1878            RestContext rc = RestContext
1879               .create(o.getClass(), null, null)
1880               .defaultClasses(BasicTestCallLogger.class)
1881               .debugDefault(CONDITIONAL)
1882               .init(()->o)
1883               .build()
1884               .postInit()
1885               .postInitChildFirst();
1886            REST_CONTEXTS.put(c, rc);
1887         }
1888         RestContext restBeanCtx = REST_CONTEXTS.get(c);
1889         builder.restContext(restBeanCtx);
1890
1891         if (servletPath == null)
1892            servletPath = toValidContextPath(restBeanCtx.getFullPath());
1893
1894         rootUrl = rootUrl + emptyIfNull(contextPath) + emptyIfNull(servletPath);
1895
1896         builder.servletPath = servletPath;
1897         builder.rootUrl(rootUrl);
1898         return builder;
1899      } catch (Exception e) {
1900         throw new ConfigException(e, "Could not initialize MockRestClient");
1901      }
1902   }

2022   /**
2023    * Returns the current client-side REST request.
2024    *
2025    * <p>
2026    * Note that this uses a {@link ThreadLocal} object for storage and so will not work on requests executed in
2027    * separate threads such as when using {@link Future Futures}.
2028    *
2029    * @return The current client-side REST request, or <jk>null</jk> if not set.
2030    */
2031   public HttpRequest getCurrentClientRequest() {
2032      return rreq.get();
2033   }
2034
2035   /**
2036    * Returns the current client-side REST response.
2037    *
2038    * <p>
2039    * Note that this uses a {@link ThreadLocal} object for storage and so will not work on requests executed in
2040    * separate threads such as when using {@link Future Futures}.
2041    *
2042    * @return The current client-side REST response, or <jk>null</jk> if not set.
2043    */

2045      return rres.get();
2046   }

2097   @Override /* HttpClientConnection */
2098   public void close() throws IOException {
2099      // Don't call super.close() because it will close the client.
2100      rreq.remove();
2101      rres.remove();
2102      sreq.remove();
2103      sres.remove();
2104   }
2105
2106   @Override /* HttpClientConnection */

2108      return true;
2109   }

2113      return false;
2114   }

2136
2137   @Override /* HttpClientConnection */
2138   public void sendRequestHeader(HttpRequest request) throws HttpException, IOException {
2139      try {
2140         RequestLine rl = request.getRequestLine();
2141         String path = rl.getUri();
2142         String target = findTarget(request);
2143
2144         HttpRequest req = findRestRequest(request);
2145         rreq.set(req);
2146         rres.remove();
2147         sreq.remove();
2148         sres.remove();
2149
2150         path = target + path;
2151
2152         MockPathResolver pr = new MockPathResolver(target, contextPath, servletPath, path, null);
2153         if (pr.getError() != null)
2154            throw new IllegalStateException(pr.getError());
2155
2156         MockServletRequest r = MockServletRequest
2157            .create(request.getRequestLine().getMethod(), pr.getURI())
2158            .contextPath(pr.getContextPath())
2159            .servletPath(pr.getServletPath())
2160            .pathVars(pathVars)
2161            .debug(isDebug());
2162
2163         for (Header h : request.getAllHeaders())
2164            r.header(h.getName(), h.getValue());
2165
2166         sreq.set(r);
2167         sreq.get().applyOverrides(req);
2168      } catch (Exception e) {
2169         throw new HttpException(e.getMessage(), e);
2170      }
2171   }
2172
2173   /**
2174    * Attempts to unwrap the request to find the underlying RestRequest object.
2175    * Returns the same object if one of the low-level client methods are used (e.g. execute(HttpUriRequest)).
2176    */
2177   private HttpRequest findRestRequest(HttpRequest req) {
2178      if (req instanceof RestRequestCreated)
2179         return ((RestRequestCreated)req).getRestRequest();
2180      if (req instanceof HttpRequestWrapper)
2181         return findRestRequest(((HttpRequestWrapper) req).getOriginal());
2182      return req;
2183   }
2184
2185   private String findTarget(HttpRequest req) {
2186      if (req instanceof HttpRequestWrapper) {
2187         HttpHost httpHost = ((HttpRequestWrapper)req).getTarget();
2188         if (httpHost != null)
2189            return httpHost.toURI();
2190      }
2191      return "http://localhost";
2192   }
2193
2194   @Override /* HttpClientConnection */
2195   public void sendRequestEntity(HttpEntityEnclosingRequest request) throws HttpException, IOException {
2196      byte[] body = {};
2197      HttpEntity entity = request.getEntity();
2198      if (entity != null) {
2199         long length = entity.getContentLength();
2200         if (length < 0)
2201            length = 1024;
2202         ByteArrayOutputStream baos = new ByteArrayOutputStream((int)Math.min(length, 1024));
2203         entity.writeTo(baos);
2204         baos.flush();
2205         body = baos.toByteArray();
2206      }
2207      sreq.get().content(body);
2208   }
2209
2210   @Override /* HttpClientConnection */
2211   public HttpResponse receiveResponseHeader() throws HttpException, IOException {
2212      try {
2213         MockServletResponse res = MockServletResponse.create();
2214         restContext.execute(restObject, sreq.get(), res);
2215
2216         // If the status isn't set, something's broken.
2217         if (res.getStatus() == 0)
2218            throw new IllegalStateException("Response status was 0.");
2219
2220         // A bug in HttpClient causes an infinite loop if the response is less than 200.
2221         // As a workaround, just add 1000 to the status code (which is better than an infinite loop).
2222         if (res.getStatus() < 200)
2223            res.setStatus(1000 + res.getStatus());
2224
2225         sres.set(res);
2226
2227         HttpResponse response = new BasicHttpResponse(new BasicStatusLine(HttpVersion.HTTP_1_1, res.getStatus(), res.getMessage()));
2228         res.getHeaders().forEach((k,v) -> {
2229            for (String hv : v)
2230               response.addHeader(k, hv);
2231         });
2232
2233         return response;
2234      } catch (Exception e) {
2235         throw new HttpException(emptyIfNull(e.getMessage()), e);
2236      }
2237   }
2238
2239   @Override /* HttpClientConnection */
2240   public void receiveResponseEntity(HttpResponse response) throws HttpException, IOException {
2241      InputStream is = new ByteArrayInputStream(sres.get().getContent());
2242      Header contentEncoding = response.getLastHeader("Content-Encoding");
2243      if (contentEncoding != null && contentEncoding.getValue().equalsIgnoreCase("gzip"))
2244         is = new GZIPInputStream(is);
2245      response.setEntity(new InputStreamEntity(is));
2246   }
2247
2248   @Override /* HttpClientConnection */
2249   public void flush() throws IOException {}
2250}
